data.title: Add 'Failure' to the DiagnosticSeverity enum
data.body: The current values are Error, Hint, Information, and Warning. For tests it is useful to distinguish test failure (expected value not found) from error (test failed to run for some reason, usually an unexpected exception). It would also be useful to distinguish between errors and failures in the Problem view.

data.title: Extensions: Allow for multiple publishers in extension / display on Marketplace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: package.json `publisher` type is string. Needs to be `string[]` or add new element `publishers` of type `string[]`. In the marketplace display the publishers there or have a section like http://npmjs.com for collaborators pulling from the contributors node, or maintainers node.

data.title: Update to electron 1.6.x
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23159

**Frameworks**
* V8 (53 => 56)
* Chrome (53 => 56)
* node.js (6.5.0 => 7.4.0 [breaking changes](https://github.com/nodejs/node/wiki/Breaking-changes-between-v6-and-v7))
* libuv (1.9.1 => 1.10.1)

data.title: 【php close tag fly away】  php formatter problem
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 (64)

1.  I install Beautify extension to format HTML、JS 、CSS.
2.  So  i change the setting to `"editor.formatOnSave": true`，which means the code will format after save the file.

data.title: Git: Manage the ignore file
data.body:
Git integration is good in vscode but one thing is missing, ignore.

I am running Vscode 1.10.2 on MacOS Sierra 10.12.4.

Working on a project, I noticed the Git integration had discovered that .DS_Store had changed and was listed with my edited files.

I wanted to tell Git to ignore this file, but found that this option was not among the integrated git commands.  It really should be available.  All that is involved is adding a line to the project .gitignore file.

I then tried to edit the .gitignore file in Vscode, but I found I could not easily open the file.
On MacOS it is standard practice to hide system files, including those with names that begin with "."
Vscode uses the standard Mac open file dialog, which, of course, will not let me see the .gitignore file.

I looked for a way to specify the file path directly, without using the dialog, and could not do so.

Please, as well as git ignore, could you add the ability to open a file using its explicit path.

I was unable to find either of these addressed in Vscode docs or open issues.

data.title: auto jsdoc comments not completing @returns
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T13:56:35.908Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.6.2|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.6.1|
|vscode-css-formatter|aeschli|0.0.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|vscode-dash|deerawan|1.4.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.5.0|
|Theme-MaterialKit|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|2.0.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.4.0|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.4.13|;


---

The built in [Auto JSDoc comments](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_10#_auto-jsdoc-comments) is really nice. However, `@returns` not working.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a es6 class:
```js
class Foo {
    bar() {
        return "allo!";
    }
}
```

2. type `/**` above method `bar` and enter not completing the documentation, `@returns` is expected.

For example:
 String(?!\.hpp)
seems to pick up words like StringLocation (although whole word search is on)

data.title: vscode "compare with" does not highlight different indented line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: When compare .py files, the lines with different indention but same content are not highlighted. Since indention is important in python files, is there any way to make lines with different indention look different in "compare with"? Thanks.

data.title: Can't get intellisense to work - `Loading...`
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra - 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Visual Code
2. Open a large project - where multiple npm modules are present, and some npm module is linked as dependency of some other npm module

Every time i get the infinite "Loading..." popup.

Few times on smaller project I was able to make it work, but after a while it stops to work anyway.

data.title: Freezing on text completion

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file with a line containing a very long line of random characters (about 60 thousand in this case)
2. Try to type something on another line that occurs more than once in the 60,000 characters.
3. VS Code grinds to a halt trying to show all the possible text completion options.

1. Seems can not copy search result, any method?

data.title: Feature Request: do not ignore a line number in links in the terminal
data.body:
_From @TomasB on March 31, 2017 16:27_

Given the output in the integrated terminal window:

```
panic(0xa49c80, 0xc04200a090)
        C:/Go/src/runtime/panic.go:458 +0x251

```
the link in the output is parsed as `C:/Go/src/runtime/panic.go`
Probably should be `C:/Go/src/runtime/panic.go:458` and go to a specific line once clicked on it.


_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-go#901_
